channel.title: Amuse and Soundcloud
channel.description: Hey guys, I was thinking about it and I was wondering if I put my stuff out for distribution on Amuse will I lose profit if I upload the same track but free of charge to listen to on Soundcloud? I’ve seen a bunch of people do this and I’m just not sure if I’d be losing profit off of this and directing any fans of mine to Soundcloud instead of Spotify or ITunes. Please share your thoughts below. Thanks.

item.title: Amuse and Soundcloud
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
You could always put track snippets on SC with a link to iTunes/Spotify etc in the description.

Read full topic

item.title: Amuse and Soundcloud
item.dc:creator: DJC
item.description:
Tbh, I release my best music on amuse and then everything else on soundcloud. Since most people don’t actually normally use soundcloud other than auxy producers, you’ll have a good amount of ppl just waiting for your music on spotify cuz they’re too lazy to listen on sc lol, and then just let fellow auxy producers listen on SC. You’ll have a good balance, but honestly, it shouldn’t really matter much rn.

Read full topic

item.title: Amuse and Soundcloud
item.dc:creator: dylanlongworth
item.description:
What if you reverse it? Like, I just released my debut album with Amuse, but what if i also want to upload it to my personal soundcloud account or youtube?

Read full topic

item.title: Amuse and Soundcloud
item.dc:creator: BlaMeese
item.description:
I don’t think you’d loose any profit. Even though SC is free I prefer to listen to songs on Spotify because they are usually better quality anyway.

Read full topic

item.title: Amuse and Soundcloud
item.dc:creator: TXA
item.description:
Yeah you could though what trey said is true

Read full topic

item.title: Amuse and Soundcloud
item.dc:creator: TXA
item.description:
That’s what I thought. I think initially I’ll just be using Amuse to get my stuff out there, and gradually start monetizing it more and more.

Read full topic

item.title: Amuse and Soundcloud
item.dc:creator: Trey
item.description:
I would guess that any Auxy producer would spend more money on the pro membership than what they’d actually get out of it through their tracks

Read full topic

item.title: Amuse and Soundcloud
item.dc:creator: crystldawnmusic
item.description:
You could monetize your tracks on Soundcloud if you want, but you won’t be losing any profit, really. At this point, none of us Auxy producers will be making a considerable amount of profit.

Read full topic

item.title: Amuse and Soundcloud
item.dc:creator: Phoenix
item.description:
If you want you could get a pro account and have teacks that you can only listen to with that

Read full topic

Hey guys, I was thinking about it and I was wondering if I put my stuff out for distribution on Amuse will I lose profit if I upload the same track but free of charge to listen to on Soundcloud?
